result.formatted_address: Lesi Ukrainky Blvd, 4, Sviatopetrivske, Kyivs'ka oblast, Ukraine, 08144
result.name: Coffee KIDS

reviews.text:
I visited the establishment last week and really liked the coffee. Although it took a little longer to prepare than usual in other coffee shops. As for the staff, the girls are very courteous and caring. Overall I was pleased.
Well done for creating a summer terrace, it’s very convenient.

Before this establishment appeared, there was a beautiful, cozy alley that was pleasant to walk along. Now it looks more like a garbage dump, someone smokes all the time, there is noise, we don’t go there with children anymore. Apparently, the owners are only interested in money, that’s all

They turned a cozy green alley into an eternal booth and trash heap. Most of the lawns were tiled. Due to damaged roots, two trees are already drying out. The remains of the lawn were trampled by the “cultural” visitors of this “cultural” institution. The housing office of the Petrovsky quarter is ready to sell not only the local area and lawns, but also the residents themselves for money.

It’s funny and sad to watch people sitting among the dug up former lawn and the dump created by the owner of the “cafe”. But the visitors are a match for the owner, who does not respect anyone or anything except his own profit. The owner of the cafe stole their local area from the residents and destroyed a large piece of green space, which is already sparse in the residential complex. And they go and bring him their money, that is, they don’t even respect themselves) This so-called “cafe” is a sad sight.

It’s a pity that Google doesn’t give you the opportunity to give 0 stars, because a 1 star rating for this “establishment” is a gift from above.

Let me start by saying that I walked past Coffee Kids by drivemafia with my little niece and decided to stop in to order a drink.

The first thing that immediately confused me was the lack of masks among the staff. I think that next time I can call the police and write a complaint to the sanitary and epidemiological station, since it is precisely because of such irresponsible “individuals” that our country still has high disease rates. I wouldn’t be surprised if, after drinking coffee, you acquire a bunch of various infections. Who knows, maybe someone sneezed into your drink.

The second point is the complete lack of education on the part of the owner of the establishment. I didn’t think that an adult man could behave like that with people around him and express himself rudely in front of children. Therefore, if your child has not learned to speak, feel free to take him to coffee kids by drivemafia, where he will learn the delights of all the languages ​​of the world (though not entirely cultural ones)

Third, cutting down trees in front of the establishment. I thought that after so many environmental incidents in the world, our people would think about the consequences of cutting down at least one tree. But no! As there was chaos, so it will be. It took the oak 20 years to take root, to release the oxygen that our children, and indeed we ourselves, breathe. But then a “man” appeared in the Petrovsky Quarter residential complex, who decided that he didn’t care about nature, he didn’t care about the future generation - he could cut down every living thing and go unpunished. The most offensive thing is that in our beautiful neighborhood there are still people who visit this establishment and thus approve of cruel crimes against the environment.

In general, I can call it all escapism. If similar things happened abroad, we would all unanimously transfer money to charities and post hundreds of stories on Instagram about how sorry we are. But when it comes to our own place of residence, we are all silent. Yes, of course, let’s allow such chaos to grow, but then not a single Ukrainian bill will help us resolve this situation, so don’t even dare complain about how bad our lives are. Our Petrovsky quarter is a mirror of ourselves. And in this mirror I see a rude owner, staff who do not comply with the law of Ukraine, and a disregard for nature.

If you have even a drop of self-respect, walk past this hellish cafe. Best wishes!
